gui.components.icon

Class ImgIcon

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JLabel
            • gui.components.icon.ImgIcon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CaseIcon, PeripheralIcon

    public class ImgIcon
extends javax.swing.JLabel
    Subclass of JLabel that holds a downsized icon version of a given image.
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Jacob Jones, Andrew Rottier
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • image

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage image

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImgIcon

        public ImgIcon(java.lang.String filePath)
        throws InvalidFileException
        Retrieves the image found at the passed in file path. Displays it within this icon.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the file path of the image to display in this icon
        Throws:
        InvalidFileException - if the image contained within this component can not be read into memory
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the parameter is null

      • ImgIcon

        public ImgIcon(java.lang.String filePath,
       org.imgscalr.Scalr.Method method,
       int size)
        throws InvalidFileException
        Retrieves and rezises the image found at the passed in file path. Displays it within this icon.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the file path of the image to display in this icon
        method - the ImgScalr resampling method to use
        size - the size that this icon should be shrunk down to
        Throws:
        InvalidFileException - if the image contained within this component can not be read into memory
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any parameters are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size is negative or zero

      • ImgIcon

        public ImgIcon(java.lang.String filePath,
       org.imgscalr.Scalr.Method method,
       int width,
       int height)
        throws InvalidFileException
        Retrieves and rezises the image found at the passed in file path. Displays it within this icon.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the file path of the image to display in this icon
        method - the ImgScalr resampling method to use
        width - the width that this icon should be shrunk down to
        height - the height that this icon should be shrunk down to
        Throws:
        InvalidFileException - if the image contained within this component can not be read into memory
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any parameters are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or height is negative or zero

        Retrieves the image found within the passed in Img object. Displays it within this icon.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the parameter is null

      • drawCropBox

        public void drawCropBox(java.awt.Point a,
               java.awt.Point b)
        Draws a rectangle on this icon based on the Point coordinates passed in as parameters.
        Parameters:
        a - Point object that serves as one corner of the rectangle
        b - Point object that serves as the other corner of the rectangle
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any parameters are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Point coordinates are invalid

      • resizeImage

        public void resizeImage(int width,
               int height)
        Resizes the image contained within this icon to the width and height specified in the parameters.
        Parameters:
        width - the new width of the image, in pixels
        height - the new height of the image, in pixels
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or height is negative or zero

      • retrieveImage

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage retrieveImage(java.lang.String filePath)
                                            throws InvalidFileException
        Uses the passed in file path to read the associated BufferedImage into memory.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the file path in question
        Returns:
        BufferedImage object representing the raw image found at the passed in file path
        Throws:
        InvalidFileException - if the image can not be read into memory
